titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Hendrick H. Suydam papers 1991.009
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:11:53 +0000.

did.abstract: The Hendrick Suydam papers span the period 1780 to 1806 and measure 0.1 linear feet. The papers contain one piece of correspondence, one Power of Attorney document from Hendrick Suydam to Casper Gyer, two discharges of estate, and three deeds. Two of the deeds convey land in Gravesend, and one deed conveys land in Flatbush.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1991.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Hendrick H. Suydam papers, 1991.009, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
